items.content_html: Posted by Mark Matthews, Senior Software Engineer, and Dmitry Lagun, Research Scientist, Google Research      A person's prior experience and understanding of the world generally enables them to easily infer what an object looks like in whole, even if only looking at a few 2D pictures of it. Yet the capacity for a computer to reconstruct the shape of an object in 3D given only a few images has remained a difficult algorithmic problem for years.
